meanings.sent1: The bright, flaunted colors of the flowers caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: She wore a flaunted dress to the party, standing out among the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The peacock flaunted its feathers, showing off its beauty to the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The flaunted banner waved proudly in the wind, announcing the event.
meanings.sent5: The flaunted trophy gleamed under the spotlight, symbolizing victory.

meanings.sent1: He flaunted his new car by driving it around the neighborhood multiple times.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy socialite flaunted her expensive jewelry at the charity gala.
meanings.sent3: The magician flaunted his skills, impressing the audience with his tricks.
meanings.sent4: She flaunted her knowledge during the debate, proving her expertise on the topic.
meanings.sent5: The peacock flaunted its feathers, attracting the attention of potential mates.

meanings.sent1: The flaunted attitude of the rebellious teenager caused trouble at school.
meanings.sent2: The flaunted flag represented the nation's unwavering spirit.
meanings.sent3: The cat flaunted its independence by refusing to come when called.
meanings.sent4: The flaunted confidence of the speaker captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The flaunted success of the entrepreneur inspired others to pursue their dreams.
